chapter.title: Styling Your Documents
chapter.p: For each supported output format, there exists a subfolder transform/format below the installation folder. Inside this folder, the XSL stylesheets with the conversion rules and a style definition file style.xml is stored. The format of the style definition file is dependant on the given output format.
To modify the style definition for a given format, create and edit a copy of the style.xml file. Then use the -s command line switch to point the document processor to the new style file.

section.title: Editing the CSS-Stylesheet
section.p: The central style definition for XHTML output is an old-fashioned CSS stylesheet, wrapped in an XML container. For users who have previous experience with CSS, most parts of the stylesheet should be straight-forward to figure out. The following subsections focus on pointing out the less obvious elements of the stylesheet, mostly concerning the page layout.
